intro: Johnstonella holoptera, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact, mat-like growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Johnstonella holoptera is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
